item.title: 融资紧缩 瑞典 Northvolt 将裁员 20
item.description: 瑞典电池制造商 Northvolt AB 将在全球范围内裁员 20%，并暂停扩建其位于瑞典北部的主要工厂，以应对电动汽车需求放缓带来的融资紧缩。【原文：Swedish battery maker Northvolt AB will shed 20% of its headcount globally and suspend the expansion of its main factory in Northern Sweden to stem a financing crunch as electric-vehicle demand slows.】

item.title: 谷歌人工智能增强型 Gmail 难以证明其价格合理
item.description: 谷歌的人工智能升级版 Gmail 让我欲罢不能，不知道是否值得支付高昂的订阅费。但首先...【原文：Google’s AI-upgraded Gmail has left me wanting and wondering if it’s worth the lofty subscription fee. But first...】

item.title: 德国联盟在工业会谈前就汽车行业援助问题出现分歧
item.description: 在经济部长罗伯特-哈贝克（Robert Habeck）周一主持的与汽车企业高管和劳工官员的会谈之前，德国执政联盟在如何帮助稳定该国陷入困境的汽车制造商方面仍存在分歧。【原文：Germany’s ruling coalition remains divided on how to help stabilize the country’s struggling carmakers ahead of talks Monday with auto executives and labor officials hosted by Economy Minister Robert Habeck.】

item.title: 看好娱乐业的五个理由
item.description:
文化产业经历了许多动荡，但并不全是厄运。【原文：

The culture industry has gone through a lot of upheaval, but it’s not all doom and gloom.

】

item.title: 墨西哥司法爆炸案后，阿姆罗的继任者必须收拾残局
item.description: 安德烈斯-曼努埃尔-洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔（Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador）总统留给墨西哥继任者的是动荡的货币、不温不火的经济增长和自上世纪80年代以来最严重的预算赤字。但克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆将面临的最紧迫挑战是平息投资者对即将离任的领导人全面改革司法机构的担忧。【原文：President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador is leaving his successor in Mexico a volatile currency, tepid economic growth and the widest budget deficit since the 1980s. But the most urgent challenge Claudia Sheinbaum will face is calming investor fears over the outgoing leader’s overhaul of the judiciary.】

item.title: GIC 和魁北克养老金支持布鲁克菲尔德的新兴市场转型基金
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）已为一支专门投资于新兴市场清洁能源和转型资产的基金筹集了 24 亿美元的首期资金，大约完成了目标的一半。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management has raised an initial $2.4 billion for a fund dedicated to investing in clean energy and transition assets in emerging markets, about halfway to its goal.】

item.title: 在柏林的反对声中，联合信贷银行将德国商业银行股份增至 21
item.description: 德国联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）将其在德国商业银行股份公司（Commerzbank AG）的持股比例提高到 21%，而就在几天前，德国政府表示反对收购该银行。【原文：UniCredit SpA raised its stake in Commerzbank AG to 21%, just days after the German government indicated it opposes a takeover of the lender.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。在上周降息之后，美国市场正在等待美联储下一步行动的迹象，而在欧洲和中国，市场对央行进一步行动的预期正在升温。据说英特尔已收到阿波罗数十亿美元的投资要约。以下是今天的市场话题。【原文：Good morning. US markets are waiting for signs of what’s next from the Fed after last week’s rate cut, while in Europe and China expectations are mounting for further central bank action. And Intel is said to have received a multi-billion dollar investment offer from Apollo. Here’s what markets are talking about today. — Morwenna Coniam】

item.title: 美国港口面临罢工威胁，大选季节惊心动魄
item.description: 就在美国政策制定者将重点从抑制通胀转移到巩固就业市场之际，美国经济面临着一次冲击，可能会出现大流行病期间盛行的那种供应链中断和消费者不满情绪，而且可能会危及您的日常香蕉用量。【原文：Just as US policymakers shift focus from curbing inflation to shoring up the job market, the economy faces a jolt that threatens the kind of supply-chain disruption and consumer discontent rife during the pandemic — and possibly puts your daily dose of bananas at risk.】

item.title: 光速引领印度人工智能诊断公司完成 6500 万美元融资
item.description: 印度初创企业 Qure.AI 从光速创投（Lightspeed Venture Partners）和 360 ONE Asset Management 领投的投资者那里筹集了 6500 万美元，用于扩大和开发其利用人工智能帮助检测疾病的产品。【原文：Indian startup Qure.AI raised $65 million from investors led by Lightspeed Venture Partners and 360 ONE Asset Management, gaining funds to expand and develop its products that use artificial intelligence to help detect diseases.】

item.title: 荷兰房价创两年来最大涨幅，房屋短缺问题依然存在
item.description: 由于荷兰正在努力解决住房严重短缺的问题，8 月份荷兰的房价创下了两年来的最大涨幅。【原文：Home prices in the Netherlands rose the most in two years in August as the country is struggling with a severe housing shortage.】

item.title: 外国人在印度的衍生品押注达到创纪录的 1 160 亿美元
item.description: 随着印度股市连创新高，全球基金将其衍生品赌注推高到前所未有的水平。【原文：With Indian stocks hitting successive records, global funds have pushed up their derivatives wagers to unprecedented levels.】

item.title: 中国汽车经销商面临近 200 亿美元的损失
item.description: 中国各地的汽车经销商正面临着近 200 亿美元的损失，因为消费者暂缓购买大件商品，车辆堆积在销售地。【原文：Car dealerships across China are facing losses of almost $20 billion as consumers hold off on making major purchases and vehicles pile up in sales lots.】

item.title: 明报》称香港拒绝美联社法籍记者入境
item.description: 据当地报纸《明报》报道，一名法国摄影记者试图以游客身份进入香港金融中心，但被香港拒绝入境。【原文：Hong Kong denied access to a French photojournalist who sought to enter the financial hub as a visitor, according to the local newspaper Mingpao, adding to a string of cases likely to amplify concerns over the city’s press freedoms.】

item.title: Palantir 首席执行官与华尔街互怼，直指银行业务
item.description:
亚历克斯-卡普现在身价 40 亿美元，他的公司刚刚跻身 S&P 500 强。【原文：

Alex Karp is now worth $4 billion, and his company just joined the S&P 500.

】

item.title: CVC 在波兰 7-Eleven 连锁店上的成功赌注刺激了 IPO 计划的实施
item.description: 2017 年，就在 CVC Capital Partners Plc 收购了一家相对默默无闻的波兰连锁店之后，该连锁店的经理和首席执行官踏上了日本之旅。他们的目标是：亲自研究如何才能创建一个庞大、成功的类似 7-Eleven 便利店的网络。【原文：In 2017, just after CVC Capital Partners Plc bought a relatively obscure Polish chain of shops, its managers and the business’s chief executive officer set out on a trip to Japan. Their goal: To study first hand what it takes to create a vast, successful network of 7-Eleven-like convenience stores.】

item.title: Gaw Capital 香港办公楼投标截止日期已过
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，为房地产投资公司 Gaw Capital Partners 拥有多数股权的两座香港写字楼寻找买家的截止日期已经过去。【原文：The deadline has lapsed to find buyers for stakes in two Hong Kong office buildings majority owned by real estate investment firm Gaw Capital Partners, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利的威尔逊表示将从防御型股票中获利
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）策略师认为，投资者应锁定美国防御性股票的收益，因为这些股票近期的超额收益使其估值显得昂贵。【原文：Investors should lock in gains on US defensive stocks as their recent outperformance has left valuations looking pricey, according to Morgan Stanley strategists.】

item.title: 欧洲央行称，欧洲银行正在将气候风险考虑到贷款中
item.description: 欧洲银行的最高监管机构表示，欧洲银行正在将气候风险纳入其发放抵押贷款的条款中，尽管它们并不完全了解潜在的成本。【原文：European banks are factoring climate risks into the terms of mortgages they grant, although they don’t fully grasp the potential costs, according to their top regulator.】

item.title: 美联储后股市反弹有可能为大跌添加 "加速燃料
item.description: 虽然股市在期待已久的美联储上周降息后出现反弹，但涨势中也伴随着不安。【原文：While the stock market rallied after the long-awaited Federal Reserve rate cut last week, there’s a sense of unease accompanying the gains.】

item.title: 美银美林加入越来越多看空陷入困境的奢侈品行业的合唱团
item.description: 欧洲奢侈品股票进一步下滑，因为美国银行分析师成为最新一批对这一陷入困境的行业敲响警钟的人，他们将行业领头羊路威酩轩集团（LVMH）的评级下调至中性，并下调了其他公司的评级。【原文：European luxury stocks slid further as Bank of America analysts became the latest to sound the alarm on the beleaguered sector, cutting their rating on industry bellwether LVMH to neutral and downgrading others.】

item.title: 新兴市场股市创七月新高，美联储加码刺激中国经济
item.description: 在美联储启动降息周期几天后，人们对中国正准备提供更多经济刺激的预期不断增强，新兴市场股市升至两个月来的新高。【原文：Emerging-market stocks rose to a two-month high, as expectations grew that China is gearing up to deliver more economic stimus, days after the Federal Reserve kicked off its interest-rate cutting cycle.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡新领导人如何从马克思主义叛乱走向主流社会
item.description: 20 世纪 80 年代末，阿努拉-库马拉-迪萨纳亚克加入了一个马克思列宁主义政党，该党试图暗杀斯里兰卡领导人并通过武装起义推翻政府。本周日，他通过投票和平地赢得了总统职位。【原文：In the late 1980s, Anura Kumara Dissanayake joined a Marxist-Leninist party that sought to assassinate Sri Lanka’s leaders and overthrow the government in an armed insurrection. On Sunday, he won the presidency peacefully at the ballot box.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司陷入困境后，修复英国下水道泄漏的成本将更加高昂
item.description: 如果以最近的债券销售为鉴，泰晤士水务公司的麻烦将使英国水务行业付出沉重代价。【原文：If recent bond sales are a guide, Thames Water’s troubles are going to cost the UK water industry dearly.】

item.title: 梅洛尼获得意大利预算支持，2023 年债务被下调
item.description: 对意大利数据进行的多年修订将其债务比率降低了近三个百分点，这为准备公布新预算目标的总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）政府提供了动力。【原文：A multi-year revision of Italy’s data removed almost three percentage points off its debt ratio, offering a boost to premier Giorgia Meloni’s government as it prepares to unveil new budget targets.】

item.title: 投资者消化新内阁，法国债券市场风险骤增
item.description: 法国政府债券落后于同行，因为投资者在权衡米歇尔-巴尼耶总理的新内阁所面临的挑战及其控制国家巨额赤字的能力。【原文：French government bonds lagged peers as investors weighed the challenges to Prime Minister Michel Barnier’s new cabinet and its ability to get the nation’s vast deficit under control.】

item.title: 德国债券收益率曲线自 2022 年以来首次正常化
item.description: 德国收益率曲线的一个关键部分已趋于正常，因为交易员们担心欧洲央行将需要加快降息步伐，因为人们越来越担心该地区的经济复苏已失去动力。【原文：A key segment of the German yield curve has normalized as traders bet the European Central Bank will need to accelerate the pace of interest-rate cuts as concerns grow the region’s economic recovery has run out of steam.】

item.title: 阿里尔投资公司的约翰-罗杰斯谈如何通过价值投资获胜
item.description:
被遗忘已久的选股艺术

The long forgotten art of stock picking

】

item.title: 欧元区私营部门因工厂不景气而重陷萎缩
item.description: 欧元区私营部门经济自 3 月份以来首次出现萎缩，制造业衰退加深，加剧了人们对该地区复苏动力不足的担忧。【原文：The euro area’s private-sector economy shrank for the first time since March, with a deepening manufacturing downturn heightening concerns that the region’s recovery has run out of steam.】

item.title: 欧洲天然气价格因供应风险和寒冷天气而上涨
item.description: 欧洲天然气价格因供应面临地缘政治风险以及预测供暖季到来前天气将更加寒冷而上涨。【原文：European natural gas prices rose on geopolitical risks to supply and a forecast for colder weather ahead of the heating season.】
